ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Relationship of respondent to individual
Notes: 1 = Biological mom; 2 = Biological dad; 3 = Grandparent; 4 = Special education (sped) teacher; 5 = General education teacher; 6 = Occupational therapist; 7 = Speech and language therapist; 8 = Behavioral therapist; 9 = Paraprofessional; 10 = Aide; 11 = Principal; 12 = Administrator; 14 = Content teacher; 15 = Parent center director; 16 = Self; 17 = Adoptive mother; 18 = Adoptive father; 19 = Foster mother; 20 = Foster father; If you separate your obsessions and your compulsions, which occur more often? Please input as a percent - Obsessions

In the last 7 days, approximately how much of your time is occupied by obsessive-compulsive problems?
Notes: 0=None; 1=Occasional symptoms or less than 1 hour per day; 2=Frequent obsessive-compulsive symptoms or 1-3 hours per day; 3=Very frequent symptoms or 3-8 hours per day; 4=Almost constantly or more than 8 hours a day

ElementDescription: In the last 7 days, on average, what is the longest amount of consecutive waking hours per day that you are completely free of obsessive-compulsive problems?
Notes: 0=No symptoms; 1=Long symptom-free interval, more than 8 consecutive hours per day symptom-free; 2=Moderately long symptom-free interval, 3-8 consecutive hours per day symptom-free; 3=Short symptom-free interval, 1-3 consecutive hours per day symptom-free; 4=Extremely short symptom-free interval, less than 1 consecutive hour per day symptom-free

ElementDescription: In the last 7 days, how much do your obsessive-compulsive problems interfere with your everyday life, work or school, or social functioning?
Notes: 0=No interference; 1=Mild, slight interference with social or occupational/school activities, but overall performance not impaired; 2=Moderate, definitive interference with social or occupational/school performance, but still manageable; 3=Severe interference, causes substantial impairment in social or occupational/school performance; 4=Extreme, incapacitating interference

ElementDescription: In the last 7 days, how much distress do your obsessive-compulsive problems cause you?
Notes: 0=None; 1=Mild, not too disturbing; 2=Moderate, disturbing, but still manageable; 3=Severe, very disturbing distress; 4=Extreme, near constant and disabling distress

ElementDescription: In the last 7 days, how much control do you have over your obsessive-compulsive problems? How successful are you in stopping or diverting them? If you rarely try to resist, please think about those rare occasions in which you did try.
Notes: 0=Complete control; 1=Much control, usually able to stop or divert obsessive-compulsive problems with some effort/concentration; 2=Moderate control, sometimes able to stop or divert obsessive-compulsive problems only with difficulty; 3=Little control, rarely successful in stopping or dismissing obsessive-compulsive problems, but they can be delayed for the moment; 4=No control, are rarely able, even momentarily, to ignore obsessions or refrain from performing compulsions, they cannot even be delayed for the moment

ElementDescription: In the last 7 days, have you been avoiding doing anything, going anyplace, or being with anyone to avoid your obsessive-compulsive problems?
Notes: 0=No deliberate avoidance; 1=Mild, minimal avoidance; 2=Moderate, some avoidance clearly present; 3=Severe, much avoidance, avoidance prominent; 4=Extreme, very extensive avoidance, patient does almost everything he/she can to avoid triggering symptoms

ElementDescription: BOCS Total Score
Notes: Sum of 6 bocs_clin items. Higher score indicates higher severity.

ElementDescription: Religion/Magical thoughts/Superstition - To prevent something terrible from happening, I must have special thoughts or acts done in a special way.
Morality and justice - I am occupied with morality issues, justice, or what is right or wrong.
Symmetry/Exactness/Ordering - How things are placed or how they are positioned is important to me. It needs to feel ''just right'' (but isn''t associated with magical thinking).
Symmetry/Exactness/Ordering - I get a compelling urge to put my things in a special order.
Just right/Repeating rituals/Counting - I have a compelling urge to repeat certain actions until it feels ''just right."
Hoarding and saving - I must follow strong impulses to collect and hoard things.
Somatic obsessions - I have worries that I look peculiar; I am concerned that something is wrong with my looks.
Self-damaging behaviors - I do things that injure my body.

Notes: 0 = None; 1 = Occasional symptoms or less than 1 hour per day; 2 = Frequent obsessive-compulsive symptoms or 1-3 hours per day; 3 = Very frequent symptoms or more than 3 and up to 8 hours a day; 4 = Almost constantly or more than 8 hours a day; -99=Missing; -98=Not shown

ElementDescription: Contamination/Cleanness - I wash my hands very often or in a special way to be sure I am not dirty or contaminated.
On average, what is the longest amount of consecutive waking hours per day that you are completely free of obsessive-compulsive problems?
Notes: 0 = No symptoms; 1 = Long symptom-free interval more than 8 consecutive hours/day symptom-free; 2 = Moderately long symptom-free interval more than 3 and up to 8 consecutive hours/day symptom-free; 3 = Short symptom-free interval from 1 to 3 consecutive hours/day symptom-free; 4 = Extremely short symptom-free interval less than 1 consecutive hour/day symptom-free; -99=Missing; -98=Not shown

ElementDescription: How much do your obsessive-compulsive problems interfere with your everyday life, work or school, or social functioning?
Notes: 0 = No interference; 1 = Mild slight interference w/ social or occupational/school activities, but overall performance not impaired; 2 = Moderate definite interference w/ social or occupational/school performance, but still manageable; 3 = Severe interference causes substantial impairment in social or occupational/school performance; 4 = Extreme incapacitating interference; -99=Missing; -98=Not shown

ElementDescription: How much distress do your obsessive-compulsive problems cause you?
Notes: 0 = None; 1 = Mild not too disturbing; 2 = Moderate disturbing, but still manageable; 3 = Severe very disturbing distress; 4 = Extreme near constant and disabling distress; -99=Missing; -98=Not shown

ElementDescription: How much control do you have over your obsessive-compulsive problems? How successful are you in stopping or diverting them?
Notes: 0 = Complete control; 1 = Much control, usually able to stop or divert obsessive-compulsive problems w/ some effort/concentration; 2 = Moderate control, sometimes able to stop or divert obsessive-compulsive problems only w/ difficulty; 3 = Little control, rarely successful in stopping or dismissing obsessive-compulsive problems, but they can be delayed for the moment; 4 = No control, are rarely able, even momentarily, to ignore obsessions or refrain from performing compulsions, they cannot even be delayed for the moment; -99=Missing; -98=Not shown

ElementDescription: Have you been avoiding doing anything, going anyplace, or being with anyone to avoid your obsessive-compulsive problems?
Notes: 0 = No deliberate avoidance; 1 = Mild, minimal avoidance; 2 = Moderate, some avoidance, clearly present; 3 = Severe, much avoidance; avoidance prominent; 4 = Extreme, very extensive avoidance; -99=Missing; -98= Not shown

ElementDescription: Mean BOCS severity score - 1.5 or higher is cutoff
Harming obsessions - I fear that my actions might harm others.
Harming obsessions - I fear I will lose control and do something I don''t want to do.
Sexual obsessions - I have unpleasant, forbidden, or perverse sexual thoughts, images, or impulses that frighten me.
Checking - I must check the stove or other electrical appliances, that I have locked the door, or to make sure things have not disappeared.
Religion/Magical thoughts/Superstition - My dirty words, thoughts, and curses directed towards God bother me; I have a fear of offending God.
